alert.note: Alert for Kent; New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 5:44PM EDT until July 29 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern New Castle County in northern Delaware... Kent County in central Delaware... Northeastern Queen Anne`s County in northeastern Maryland... Northeastern Caroline County in eastern Maryland... Northeastern Kent County in northeastern Maryland... Southwestern Salem County in southern New Jersey... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 543 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Port Penn to near Hartly to near Hope, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Dover, Middletown, Smyrna, Centreville, Camden, Clayton, Cheswold, Church Hill, Millington, Sudlersville, Bowers, Goldsboro, Woodside, Viola, Hartly, Hazlettville, Delaney Corner, Crumpton, Dover Speedway and Sandtown. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. In addition to large hail and damaging winds, frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
